content.description: The less popular of two routes that climb the vertical wall with a large bulge at the top. Begins in a crack feature.
content.location: 1st climb from left on Tribal War wall

content.description: This hidden gem gets no stars in the guide book, but it is a fun outing.  The climbing is mostly on good pockets and edges up a vertical wall.  A good warm up for the hard lines nearby.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of Tribal War 5.11b.  There is a horizontal slash in the wall at the second bolt.

content.description: Thoughtful climbing on the prow. Steeper at the bottom to vert/slab above.
content.location: Left of Stone Ranger and right of Stirrup Trouble.

content.description: One of the best 5.11's at the OK.  The technical crux is on the slab, but a pumpy finish waits for you above.  Get a good rest before the final headwall. There are large buckets on this steep section, but you might get pumped out by clipping all of the closely spaced bolts.
content.location: This route is on far left side of the cliff.

content.description: Start on some thin edges and work into a tips seam to gain a stance before the overhang (burly).  Pull a few underclings and reach up to a shallow flake system to a slab finish.
content.location: Just around the corner to the right of Tribal War face.

content.description: Thin movement on pockets and edges. Sustained climbing from the ground to 3rd bolt.
content.location: Right of Tribal War on the west facing wall.

content.description: Scramble off the ledge through sharp featured rock to gain first bolt. Low slab crux between 2nd & 3rd bolt then cruiser up to bulge. Another .10 sequence as you climb into the bulge before finishing on hero pockets.
content.location: This is currently the left most route at the OK Corral. Two left of Tribal War and immediately left of Western Front. Climbs the slabby column feature to slightly overhanging head wall. Bolted 6/29/14 by Jayroe. Thank you to B.A.R.F. for the anchors and hangers. Thank you to the Laramie crew for the on sight cash donation. Thank you to Marley for letting me borrow his drill.

content.description: Alternate left ending to Rope the Moon. Climb the first 5 bolts of Rope the Moon to the obvious horizontal before the bulge. Follow the bolts trending left up the steep headwall. Good pockets.
content.location: Tribal War Sector. Left of Western Front. The left most route on the wall.

content.description: Begin with a powerful start and fight the pump on the thin pockets and crimps to the top.
content.location: Tribal War area, currently marked at the base with a sign indicating the route name and grade.

content.description: This is a fun little route found just to the left of Urban Cowboy.  The crux is down low between the first and second bolts where it is a little bit thin, then follow the obvious flake to the easy slab above.
content.protection: 5 Bolts to bolted anchor with rap rings
content.location: Between Deputized, climber’s left, and Urban Cowboy on the right.

pathTokens: 1. Left Side (Lunarscape, Tribal War, Poker-Face, Lone Pilgrim)
